summary: This is an FBI operational report dated August 6, 2020, summarizing major cases for the week. It includes updates on several child pornography and sexual abuse investigations in the SDNY, including arrests, search warrants, and guilty pleas. Notably, it references an ongoing investigation into Jeffrey Epstein for child sex trafficking under file number 50D-NY-3027571.

persons.name: Anthony Vega
persons.context: Admitted to distributing child pornography to an online covert employee (OCE) and seeking out minors online for sexual dialogue and meetings. A search warrant was executed at his Bronx apartment on August 5, 2020.

persons.name: Matt Deragon
persons.context: The Special Agent (SA) associated with the investigation of Anthony Vega (case 305I-NY-3281048).

persons.name: Abraham Machuca-Hernandez
persons.role: Defendant charged with possession of child pornography
persons.context: Subject of a complaint being sworn out in SDNY on August 6, 2020, for possession of child pornography. Was previously arrested in January 2019 after a November 2018 search warrant.

persons.name: Kris Serra
persons.context: The Special Agent (SA) associated with the investigation of Abraham Machuca-Hernandez (case 305A-NY-3016542).

persons.name: Ryan Ragonese
persons.role: Defendant who pled guilty to child pornography charges
persons.context: Pled guilty in SDNY on July 29, 2020, to Receipt and Possession of Child Pornography. A registered sex offender due to a prior conviction for sexually abusing an eight-year-old girl, facing a mandatory 15-year minimum sentence.

persons.name: Liz Jensen
persons.context: The Special Agent (SA) associated with the investigations of Ryan Ragonese (case 305A-NY-2980958) and Davis Burgos-Collazo (case 305A-NY-3289680).

persons.name: Davis Burgos-Collazo
persons.context: Also known as Davis Collazo-Burgos and "LoveSteven." A registered sex offender in Queens, NY, who previously served 4 years for sexually abusing three girls. A search warrant was executed on his LiveMe account on July 24, 2020.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.role: Subject of child sex trafficking investigation
persons.context: Named as the subject of an ongoing FBI investigation (file 50D-NY-3027571) for child sex trafficking. The investigation is noted as 'Pending'.

persons.name: Blanca Estella Hernandez Morales
persons.context: Also known as "Nancy," listed as a subject in a pen register operation (31E-NY-2058945).

persons.name: Roberto Cesar Cid-Dominguez
persons.role: Subject associated with a pen register
persons.context: Listed in association with a pen register operation (31E-NY-2058945).

connections.description: SA Matt Deragon is the investigating agent for the case against Anthony Vega for child pornography distribution.
SA Kris Serra is the investigating agent for the child pornography case against Abraham Machuca-Hernandez.
SA Liz Jensen is the case agent for the investigation that led to Ryan Ragonese's guilty plea for child pornography.
SA Liz Jensen is the investigating agent for the case involving Davis Burgos-Collazo and his LiveMe account.
Both are listed as subjects in the same pen register operation (31E-NY-2058945).

events.title: Search warrant executed on Anthony Vega's apartment
events.description: A search warrant issued in the SDNY was executed at 111 W 183rd St, Apt 4F, Bronx, NY. Anthony Vega admitted to agents that he had distributed child pornography and sought out minors online.

events.title: Complaint sworn against Abraham Machuca-Hernandez
events.description: A complaint was being sworn out in the SDNY charging Abraham Machuca-Hernandez with possession of child pornography, leading to a planned arrest on August 7, 2020.

events.title: Ryan Ragonese pleads guilty
events.description: Ryan Ragonese pled guilty in SDNY to Receipt and Possession of Child Pornography. He faces a mandatory 15-year minimum sentence.

events.title: Search warrant executed on LiveMe account
events.description: A search warrant was executed on the LiveMe account "LoveSteven," linked to registered sex offender Davis Burgos-Collazo.

events.title: Weekly FBI operational reporting period
events.description: The document covers major operational matters for the week of August 1-7, 2020, including multiple child exploitation investigations.

keyFacts: The document confirms an active, pending FBI investigation into Jeffrey Epstein for child sex trafficking under file number 50D-NY-3027571 as of August 2020.
Multiple separate child pornography and sexual abuse investigations were active in the SDNY during this reporting period, resulting in search warrants, arrests, and a guilty plea.
Ryan Ragonese, a registered sex offender for prior abuse of an 8-year-old girl, pled guilty to child pornography charges and faced a mandatory 15-year minimum sentence.
Davis Burgos-Collazo, a registered sex offender who served 4 years for abusing three young girls, was under investigation for activity on a LiveMe account.
The document is a standard FBI weekly operational report, indicating the Epstein investigation was one among many ongoing cases being tracked by the bureau.
